questions.text: Which term describes the ability of a receiver to discriminate between multiple signals?

questions.label: T7A05
questions.text: What is the name of a circuit that generates a signal at a specific frequency?

questions.label: T7A06
questions.text: What device converts the RF input and output of a transceiver to another band?

questions.label: T7A07
questions.text: What is meant by “PTT”?
distractors: Pre-transmission tuning to reduce transmitter harmonic emission
Precise tone transmissions used to limit repeater access to only certain signals
A primary transformer tuner use to match antennas
questions.answer: The push-to-talk function that switches between receive and transmit

questions.label: T7A08
questions.text: Which of the following describes combining speech with an RF carrier signal?

questions.label: T7A09
questions.text: What is the function of the SSB/CW-FM switch on a VHF power amplifier?
distractors: Change the mode of the transmitted signal
Change the frequency range of the amplifier to operate in the proper portion of the band
questions.answer: Set the amplifier for proper operation in the selected mode

questions.label: T7A10
questions.text: What device increases the low-power output from a handheld transceiver?
distractors: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T7A11
questions.text: Where is an RF preamplifier installed?
distractors: At the output of the transmitter's power amplifier
Between a transmitter and antenna tuner

subTopics.label: T7B
subTopics.description: Common transmitter and receiver problems: symptoms of overload and overdrive; distortion; causes of interference; interference and consumer electronics; part 15 devices; over-modulation; RF feedback; off frequency signals

questions.label: T7B01
questions.text: What can you do if you are told your FM handheld or mobile transceiver is over-deviating?
distractors: Change to a higher power level
questions.answer: Talk farther away from the microphone

questions.label: T7B02
questions.text: What would cause a broadcast AM or FM radio to receive an amateur radio transmission unintentionally?
distractors: The microphone gain of the transmitter is turned up too high
The audio amplifier of the transmitter is overloaded
The deviation of an FM transmitter is set too low
questions.answer: The receiver is unable to reject strong signals outside the AM or FM band

questions.label: T7B03
questions.text: Which of the following can cause radio frequency interference?
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T7B04
questions.text: Which of the following is a way to reduce or eliminate interference from an amateur transmitter to a nearby telephone?
distractors: Put a filter on the amateur transmitter
Reduce the SWR on the transmitter transmission line
questions.answer: Put an RF filter on the telephone

questions.label: T7B05
questions.text: How can overload of a non-amateur radio or TV receiver by an amateur signal be reduced or eliminated?
distractors: Block the interfering signal with a filter on the amateur transmitter
Switch the transmitter from FM to SSB
Switch the transmitter to a narrow-band mode
questions.answer: Block the amateur signal with a filter at the antenna input of the affected receiver

questions.label: T7B06
questions.text: Which of the following actions should you take if a neighbor tells you that your station’s transmissions are interfering with their radio or TV reception?
distractors: Immediately turn off your transmitter and contact the nearest FCC office for assistance
Tell them that your license gives you the right to transmit and nothing can be done to reduce the interference
Install a harmonic doubler on the output of your transmitter and tune it until the interference is eliminated
questions.answer: Make sure that your station is functioning properly and that it does not cause interference to your own radio or television when it is tuned to the same channel

questions.label: T7B07
questions.text: Which of the following can reduce overload to a VHF transceiver from a nearby FM broadcast station?
distractors: Using headphones instead of the speaker

questions.label: T7B08
questions.text: What should you do if something in a neighbor’s home is causing harmful interference to your amateur station?
distractors: Work with your neighbor to identify the offending device
Politely inform your neighbor about the rules that prohibit the use of devices that cause interference
Check your station and make sure it meets the standards of good amateur practice
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T7B09
questions.text: What is a Part 15 device?
distractors: An amplifier that has been type-certified for amateur radio
A device for long-distance communications using special codes sanctioned by the International Amateur Radio Union
A type of test set used to determine whether a transmitter complies with FCC regulation 91.15
questions.answer: An unlicensed device that may emit low-powered radio signals on frequencies used by a licensed service

questions.label: T7B10
questions.text: What might be a problem if you receive a report that your audio signal through the repeater is distorted or unintelligible?
distractors: Your transmitter is slightly off frequency
You are in a bad location
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T7B11
questions.text: What is a symptom of RF feedback in a transmitter or transceiver?
distractors: Excessive SWR at the antenna connection
The transmitter will not stay on the desired frequency
Frequent blowing of power supply fuses
questions.answer: Reports of garbled, distorted, or unintelligible voice transmissions

questions.label: T7B12
questions.text: What should be the first step to resolve cable TV interference from your ham radio transmission?
distractors: Add a low-pass filter to the TV antenna input
Add a high-pass filter to the TV antenna input
Add a preamplifier to the TV antenna input
questions.answer: Be sure all TV coaxial connectors are installed properly

subTopics.label: T7C
subTopics.description: Antenna measurements and troubleshooting: measuring SWR; dummy loads; coaxial cables; causes of feed line failures

questions.label: T7C01
questions.text: What is the primary purpose of a dummy load?
distractors: To prevent over-modulation of a transmitter
To improve the efficiency of an antenna
To improve the signal-to-noise ratio of a receiver
questions.answer: To prevent transmitting signals over the air when making tests

questions.label: T7C02
questions.text: Which of the following instruments can be used to determine if an antenna is resonant at the desired operating frequency?

questions.label: T7C03
questions.text: What, in general terms, is standing wave ratio (SWR)?
distractors: The ratio of high to low impedance in a feed line
An indication of the quality of your station’s ground connection
questions.answer: A measure of how well a load is matched to a transmission line

questions.label: T7C04
questions.text: What reading on an SWR meter indicates a perfect impedance match between the antenna and the feed line?

questions.label: T7C05
questions.text: Why do most solid-state amateur radio transmitters reduce output power as SWR increases?
distractors: To comply with FCC rules on spectral purity
Because power supplies cannot supply enough current at high SWR
To improve the impedance match to the feed line
questions.answer: To protect the output amplifier transistors

questions.label: T7C06
questions.text: What does an SWR reading of 4:1 indicate?

questions.label: T7C07
questions.text: What happens to power lost in a feed line?
distractors: It comes back into your transmitter and could cause damage
It can cause distortion of your signal

questions.label: T7C08
questions.text: What instrument other than an SWR meter could you use to determine if a feed line and antenna are properly matched?

questions.label: T7C09
questions.text: Which of the following is the most common cause for failure of coaxial cables?

questions.label: T7C10
questions.text: Why should the outer jacket of coaxial cable be resistant to ultraviolet light?
distractors: Ultraviolet resistant jackets prevent harmonic radiation
Ultraviolet light can increase losses in the cable’s jacket
Ultraviolet and RF signals can mix, causing interference
questions.answer: Ultraviolet light can damage the jacket and allow water to enter the cable

questions.label: T7C11
questions.text: What is a disadvantage of air core coaxial cable when compared to foam or solid dielectric types?
distractors: It has more loss per foot
It cannot be used for VHF or UHF antennas
It cannot be used at below freezing temperatures
questions.answer: It requires special techniques to prevent water absorption

questions.label: T7C12
questions.text: What does a dummy load consist of?
distractors: A high-gain amplifier and a TR switch
A low-voltage power supply and a DC relay
A 50 ohm reactance used to terminate a transmission line
questions.answer: A non-inductive resistor and a heat sink

subTopics.label: T7D
subTopics.description: Basic repair and testing: soldering; using basic test instruments; connecting a voltmeter, ammeter, or ohmmeter

questions.label: T7D01
questions.text: Which instrument would you use to measure electric potential or electromotive force?

questions.label: T7D02
questions.text: What is the correct way to connect a voltmeter to a circuit?

questions.label: T7D03
questions.text: How is a simple ammeter connected to a circuit?

questions.label: T7D04
questions.text: Which instrument is used to measure electric current?

questions.label: T7D05
questions.text: What instrument is used to measure resistance?

questions.label: T7D06
questions.text: Which of the following might damage a multimeter?
distractors: Measuring a voltage too small for the chosen scale
Leaving the meter in the milliamps position overnight
Not allowing it to warm up properly
questions.answer: Attempting to measure voltage when using the resistance setting

questions.label: T7D07
questions.text: Which of the following measurements are commonly made using a multimeter?

questions.label: T7D08
questions.text: Which of the following types of solder is best for radio and electronic use?

questions.label: T7D09
questions.text: What is the characteristic appearance of a cold solder joint?

questions.label: T7D10
questions.text: What is probably happening when an ohmmeter, connected across an unpowered circuit, initially indicates a low resistance and then shows increasing resistance with time?
distractors: The circuit contains a large inductor
The circuit is a relaxation oscillator
questions.answer: The circuit contains a large capacitor

questions.label: T7D11
questions.text: Which of the following precautions should be taken when measuring circuit resistance with an ohmmeter?
distractors: Ensure that the applied voltages are correct
Ensure that the circuit is grounded
Ensure that the circuit is operating at the correct frequency
questions.answer: Ensure that the circuit is not powered

questions.label: T7D12
questions.text: Which of the following precautions should be taken when measuring high voltages with a voltmeter?
distractors: Ensure that the voltmeter has very low impedance
Ensure that the circuit is grounded through the voltmeter
Ensure that the voltmeter is set to the correct frequency
questions.answer: Ensure that the voltmeter and leads are rated for use at the voltages to be measured

SubElements.label: T8
SubElements.description: Modulation modes: amateur satellite operation; operating activities; non-voice and digital communications

subTopics.label: T8A
subTopics.description: Modulation modes: bandwidth of various signals; choice of emission type

questions.label: T8A01
questions.text: Which of the following is a form of amplitude modulation?

questions.label: T8A02
questions.text: What type of modulation is most commonly used for VHF packet radio transmissions?

questions.label: T8A03
questions.text: Which type of voice mode is most often used for long-distance (weak signal) contacts on the VHF and UHF bands?

questions.label: T8A04
questions.text: Which type of modulation is most commonly used for VHF and UHF voice repeaters?

questions.label: T8A05
questions.text: Which of the following types of emission has the narrowest bandwidth?

questions.label: T8A06
questions.text: Which sideband is normally used for 10 meter HF, VHF, and UHF single-sideband communications?

questions.label: T8A07
questions.text: What is an advantage of single sideband (SSB) over FM for voice transmissions?
distractors: SSB signals are easier to tune
SSB signals are less susceptible to interference
All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T8A08
questions.text: What is the approximate bandwidth of a single sideband (SSB) voice signal?

questions.label: T8A09
questions.text: What is the approximate bandwidth of a VHF repeater FM phone signal?

questions.label: T8A10
questions.text: What is the typical bandwidth of analog fast-scan TV transmissions on the 70 centimeter band?

questions.label: T8A11
questions.text: What is the approximate maximum bandwidth required to transmit a CW signal?

subTopics.label: T8B
subTopics.description: Amateur satellite operation; Doppler shift; basic orbits; operating protocols; transmitter power considerations; telemetry and telecommand; satellite tracking

questions.label: T8B01
questions.text: What telemetry information is typically transmitted by satellite beacons?
distractors: The signal strength of received signals
Time of day accurate to plus or minus 1/10 second
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: Health and status of the satellite

questions.label: T8B02
questions.text: What is the impact of using too much effective radiated power on a satellite uplink?
distractors: Possibility of commanding the satellite to an improper mode
Possibility of rebooting the satellite control computer

questions.label: T8B03
questions.text: Which of the following are provided by satellite tracking programs?
distractors: Maps showing the real-time position of the satellite track over the earth
The time, azimuth, and elevation of the start, maximum altitude, and end of a pass
The apparent frequency of the satellite transmission, including effects of Doppler shift
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T8B04
questions.text: What mode of transmission is commonly used by amateur radio satellites?
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T8B05
questions.text: What is a satellite beacon?
distractors: The primary transmit antenna on the satellite
An indicator light that shows where to point your antenna
A reflective surface on the satellite
questions.answer: A transmission from a satellite that contains status information

questions.label: T8B06
questions.text: Which of the following are inputs to a satellite tracking program?
distractors: The last observed time of zero Doppler shift
All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T8B07
questions.text: With regard to satellite communications, what is Doppler shift?
distractors: A change in the satellite orbit
A mode where the satellite receives signals on one band and transmits on another
A special digital communications mode for some satellites
questions.answer: An observed change in signal frequency caused by relative motion between the satellite and the earth station

questions.label: T8B08
questions.text: What is meant by the statement that a satellite is operating in mode U/V?
distractors: The satellite uplink is in the 15 meter band and the downlink is in the 10 meter band
The satellite operates using ultraviolet frequencies
The satellite frequencies are usually variable
questions.answer: The satellite uplink is in the 70 centimeter band and the downlink is in the 2 meter band

questions.label: T8B09
questions.text: What causes spin fading of satellite signals?
distractors: Circular polarized noise interference radiated from the sun
Doppler shift of the received signal
Interfering signals within the satellite uplink band
questions.answer: Rotation of the satellite and its antennas

questions.label: T8B10
questions.text: What do the initials LEO tell you about an amateur satellite?
distractors: The satellite battery is in Low Energy Operation mode
The satellite is performing a Lunar Ejection Orbit maneuver
The satellite uses Light Emitting Optics
questions.answer: The satellite is in a Low Earth Orbit

questions.label: T8B11
questions.text: Who may receive telemetry from a space station?
distractors: A licensed radio amateur with a transmitter equipped for interrogating the satellite
A licensed radio amateur who has been certified by the protocol developer
A licensed radio amateur who has registered for an access code from AMSAT
questions.answer: Anyone who can receive the telemetry signal

questions.label: T8B12
questions.text: Which of the following is a good way to judge whether your uplink power is neither too low nor too high?
distractors: Check your signal strength report in the telemetry data
Listen for distortion on your downlink signal
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: Your signal strength on the downlink should be about the same as the beacon

subTopics.label: T8C
subTopics.description: Operating activities: radio direction finding; radio control; contests; linking over the internet; grid locators

questions.label: T8C01
questions.text: Which of the following methods is used to locate sources of noise interference or jamming?

questions.label: T8C02
questions.text: Which of these items would be useful for a hidden transmitter hunt?
distractors: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T8C03
questions.text: What operating activity involves contacting as many stations as possible during a specified period?

questions.label: T8C04
questions.text: Which of the following is good procedure when contacting another station in a radio contest?
distractors: Sign only the last two letters of your call if there are many other stations calling
Contact the station twice to be sure that you are in his log
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: Send only the minimum information needed for proper identification and the contest exchange

questions.label: T8C05
questions.text: What is a grid locator?
distractors: A letter-number designator assigned to an azimuth and elevation
An instrument for neutralizing a final amplifier
An instrument for radio direction finding
questions.answer: A letter-number designator assigned to a geographic location

questions.label: T8C06
questions.text: How is access to some IRLP nodes accomplished?
distractors: By obtaining a password that is sent via voice to the node
By entering the proper internet password

questions.label: T8C07
questions.text: What is meant by Voice Over Internet Protocol (VoIP) as used in amateur radio?
distractors: A set of rules specifying how to identify your station when linked over the internet to another station
A set of guidelines for contacting DX stations during contests using internet access
A technique for measuring the modulation quality of a transmitter using remote sites monitored via the internet
questions.answer: A method of delivering voice communications over the internet using digital techniques

questions.label: T8C08
questions.text: What is the Internet Radio Linking Project (IRLP)?
distractors: A system for providing access to websites via amateur radio
A system for informing amateurs in real time of the frequency of active DX stations
A technique for measuring signal strength of an amateur transmitter via the internet
questions.answer: A technique to connect amateur radio systems, such as repeaters, via the internet using Voice Over Internet Protocol (VoIP)

questions.label: T8C09
questions.text: How might you obtain a list of active nodes that use VoIP?
distractors: By subscribing to an on line service
From on line repeater lists maintained by the local repeater frequency coordinator
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T8C10
questions.text: What must be done before you may use the EchoLink system to communicate using a repeater?
distractors: You must complete the required EchoLink training
You must have purchased a license to use the EchoLink software
You must be sponsored by a current EchoLink user
questions.answer: You must register your call sign and provide proof of license

questions.label: T8C11
questions.text: What name is given to an amateur radio station that is used to connect other amateur stations to the internet?

subTopics.label: T8D
subTopics.description: Non-voice and digital communications: image signals; digital modes; CW; packet radio; PSK31; APRS; error detection and correction; NTSC; amateur radio networking; Digital Mobile/Migration Radio

questions.label: T8D01
questions.text: Which of the following is a digital communications mode?
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T8D02
questions.text: What does the term “APRS” mean?

questions.label: T8D03
questions.text: Which of the following devices is used to provide data to the transmitter when sending automatic position reports from a mobile amateur radio station?
distractors: A connection to a broadcast FM sub-carrier receiver

questions.label: T8D04
questions.text: What type of transmission is indicated by the term "NTSC?"
distractors: A Normal Transmission mode in Static Circuit
A special mode for earth satellite uplink
A frame compression scheme for TV signals
questions.answer: An analog fast scan color TV signal

questions.label: T8D05
questions.text: Which of the following is an application of APRS (Automatic Packet Reporting System)?
distractors: Showing automatically the number of packets transmitted via PACTOR during a specific time interval
Providing voice over internet connection between repeaters
Providing information on the number of stations signed into a repeater
questions.answer: Providing real-time tactical digital communications in conjunction with a map showing the locations of stations

questions.label: T8D06
questions.text: What does the abbreviation "PSK" mean?

questions.label: T8D07
questions.text: Which of the following best describes DMR (Digital Mobile Radio)?
distractors: An automatic position tracking mode for FM mobiles communicating through repeaters
An automatic computer logging technique for hands-off logging when communicating while operating a vehicle
A digital technique for transmitting on two repeater inputs simultaneously for automatic error correction
questions.answer: A technique for time-multiplexing two digital voice signals on a single 12.5 kHz repeater channel

questions.label: T8D08
questions.text: Which of the following may be included in packet transmissions?
distractors: A check sum that permits error detection
A header that contains the call sign of the station to which the information is being sent
Automatic repeat request in case of error
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T8D09
questions.text: What code is used when sending CW in the amateur bands?
distractors: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T8D10
questions.text: Which of the following operating activities is supported by digital mode software in the WSJT suite?
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T8D11
questions.text: What is an ARQ transmission system?
distractors: A special transmission format limited to video signals
A system used to encrypt command signals to an amateur radio satellite
A method of compressing the data in a message so more information can be sent in a shorter time
questions.answer: A digital scheme whereby the receiving station detects errors and sends a request to the sending station to retransmit the information

questions.label: T8D12
questions.text: Which of the following best describes Broadband-Hamnet(TM), also referred to as a high-speed multi-media network?
distractors: A wide-bandwidth digital voice mode employing DRM protocols
A satellite communications network using modified commercial satellite TV hardware
An internet linking protocol used to network repeaters
questions.answer: An amateur-radio-based data network using commercial Wi-Fi gear with modified firmware

questions.label: T8D13
questions.text: What is FT8?
distractors: An eight channel multiplex mode for FM repeaters
A digital slow scan TV mode with forward error correction and automatic color compensation
questions.answer: A digital mode capable of operating in low signal-to-noise conditions that transmits on 15-second intervals

questions.label: T8D14
questions.text: What is an electronic keyer?
distractors: A device for switching antennas from transmit to receive
A device for voice activated switching from receive to transmit
An interlock to prevent unauthorized use of a radio
questions.answer: A device that assists in manual sending of Morse code

subTopics.label: T9A
subTopics.description: Antennas: vertical and horizontal polarization; concept of gain; common portable and mobile antennas; relationships between resonant length and frequency; concept of dipole antennas

questions.label: T9A01
questions.text: What is a beam antenna?
distractors: An antenna built from aluminum I-beams
An omnidirectional antenna invented by Clarence Beam
An antenna that reverses the phase of received signals
questions.answer: An antenna that concentrates signals in one direction

questions.label: T9A02
questions.text: Which of the following describes a type of antenna loading?
distractors: Inserting a resistor in the radiating portion of the antenna to make it resonant
Installing a spring in the base of a mobile vertical antenna to make it more flexible
Strengthening the radiating elements of a beam antenna to better resist wind damage
questions.answer: Inserting an inductor in the radiating portion of the antenna to make it electrically longer

questions.label: T9A03
questions.text: Which of the following describes a simple dipole oriented parallel to the Earth's surface?

questions.label: T9A04
questions.text: What is a disadvantage of the “rubber duck” antenna supplied with most handheld radio transceivers when compared to a full-sized quarter-wave antenna?
distractors: It transmits only circularly polarized signals
If the rubber end cap is lost, it will unravel very easily
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: It does not transmit or receive as effectively

questions.label: T9A05
questions.text: How would you change a dipole antenna to make it resonant on a higher frequency?
distractors: Insert coils in series with radiating wires
Add capacitive loading to the ends of the radiating wires

questions.label: T9A06
questions.text: What type of antennas are the quad, Yagi, and dish?

questions.label: T9A07
questions.text: What is a disadvantage of using a handheld VHF transceiver, with its integral antenna, inside a vehicle?
distractors: It might cause the transceiver to overheat
The SWR might decrease, decreasing the signal strength
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: Signals might not propagate well due to the shielding effect of the vehicle

questions.label: T9A08
questions.text: What is the approximate length, in inches, of a quarter-wavelength vertical antenna for 146 MHz?

questions.label: T9A09
questions.text: What is the approximate length, in inches, of a half-wavelength 6 meter dipole antenna?

questions.label: T9A10
questions.text: In which direction does a half-wave dipole antenna radiate the strongest signal?
distractors: Off the ends of the antenna
In the direction of the feed line

questions.label: T9A11
questions.text: What is the gain of an antenna?
distractors: The additional power that is added to the transmitter power
The additional power that is lost in the antenna when transmitting on a higher frequency
The increase in impedance on receive or transmit compared to a reference antenna
questions.answer: The increase in signal strength in a specified direction compared to a reference antenna

questions.label: T9A12
questions.text: What is an advantage of using a properly mounted 5/8 wavelength antenna for VHF or UHF mobile service?
distractors: It has very high angle radiation for better communicating through a repeater
It eliminates distortion caused by reflected signals
It has 10 times the power gain of a 1/4 wavelength design
questions.answer: It has a lower radiation angle and more gain than a 1/4 wavelength antenna

subTopics.label: T9B
subTopics.description: Feed lines: types, attenuation vs frequency, selecting; SWR concepts; Antenna tuners (couplers); RF Connectors: selecting, weather protection

questions.label: T9B01
questions.text: Why is it important to have low SWR when using coaxial cable feed line?
distractors: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T9B02
questions.text: What is the impedance of most coaxial cables used in amateur radio installations?

questions.label: T9B03
questions.text: Why is coaxial cable the most common feed line selected for amateur radio antenna systems?
distractors: It has less loss than any other type of feed line
It can handle more power than any other type of feed line
It is less expensive than any other type of feed line
questions.answer: It is easy to use and requires few special installation considerations

questions.label: T9B04
questions.text: What is the major function of an antenna tuner (antenna coupler)?
distractors: It helps a receiver automatically tune in weak stations
It allows an antenna to be used on both transmit and receive
It automatically selects the proper antenna for the frequency band being used
questions.answer: It matches the antenna system impedance to the transceiver's output impedance

questions.label: T9B05
questions.text: In general, what happens as the frequency of a signal passing through coaxial cable is increased?

questions.label: T9B06
questions.text: Which of the following connectors is most suitable for frequencies above 400 MHz?

questions.label: T9B07
questions.text: Which of the following is true of PL-259 type coax connectors?
distractors: They are preferred for microwave operation
They are a bayonet type connector
questions.answer: They are commonly used at HF frequencies

questions.label: T9B08
questions.text: Why should coax connectors exposed to the weather be sealed against water intrusion?
distractors: To keep the jacket from becoming loose
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: To prevent an increase in feed line loss

questions.label: T9B09
questions.text: What can cause erratic changes in SWR readings?
distractors: Interference from other stations is distorting your signal
questions.answer: A loose connection in an antenna or a feed line

questions.label: T9B10
questions.text: What is the electrical difference between RG-58 and RG-8 coaxial cable?
distractors: There is no significant difference between the two types
RG-58 cable can handle higher power levels
questions.answer: RG-8 cable has less loss at a given frequency

questions.label: T9B11
questions.text: Which of the following types of feed line has the lowest loss at VHF and UHF?

SubElements.label: T0
SubElements.description: Electrical safety: AC and DC power circuits; antenna installation; RF hazards

subTopics.label: T0A
subTopics.description: Power circuits and hazards: hazardous voltages; fuses and circuit breakers; grounding; lightning protection; battery safety; electrical code compliance

questions.label: T0A01
questions.text: Which of the following is a safety hazard of a 12-volt storage battery?
distractors: Touching both terminals with the hands can cause electrical shock
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: Shorting the terminals can cause burns, fire, or an explosion

questions.label: T0A02
questions.text: What health hazard is presented by electrical current flowing through the body?
distractors: It may cause injury by heating tissue
It may disrupt the electrical functions of cells
It may cause involuntary muscle contractions
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T0A03
questions.text: In the United States, what is connected to the green wire in a three-wire electrical AC plug?

questions.label: T0A04
questions.text: What is the purpose of a fuse in an electrical circuit?
distractors: To prevent power supply ripple from damaging a circuit
To limit current to prevent shocks
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: To interrupt power in case of overload

questions.label: T0A05
questions.text: Why is it unwise to install a 20-ampere fuse in the place of a 5-ampere fuse?
distractors: The larger fuse would be likely to blow because it is rated for higher current
The power supply ripple would greatly increase
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: Excessive current could cause a fire

questions.label: T0A06
questions.text: What is a good way to guard against electrical shock at your station?
distractors: Use three-wire cords and plugs for all AC powered equipment
Connect all AC powered station equipment to a common safety ground
Use a circuit protected by a ground-fault interrupter
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T0A07
questions.text: Which of these precautions should be taken when installing devices for lightning protection in a coaxial cable feed line?
distractors: Include a parallel bypass switch for each protector so that it can be switched out of the circuit when running high power
Include a series switch in the ground line of each protector to prevent RF overload from inadvertently damaging the protector
Keep the ground wires from each protector separate and connected to station ground
questions.answer: Mount all of the protectors on a metal plate that is in turn connected to an external ground rod

questions.label: T0A08
questions.text: What safety equipment should always be included in home-built equipment that is powered from 120V AC power circuits?
distractors: An AC voltmeter across the incoming power source
An inductor in parallel with the AC power source
A capacitor in series with the AC power source
questions.answer: A fuse or circuit breaker in series with the AC hot conductor

questions.label: T0A09
questions.text: What should be done to all external ground rods or earth connections?
distractors: Waterproof them with silicone caulk or electrical tape
Keep them as far apart as possible
Tune them for resonance on the lowest frequency of operation
questions.answer: Bond them together with heavy wire or conductive strap

questions.label: T0A10
questions.text: What can happen if a lead-acid storage battery is charged or discharged too quickly?
distractors: The memory effect will reduce the capacity of the battery
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: The battery could overheat, give off flammable gas, or explode

questions.label: T0A11
questions.text: What kind of hazard might exist in a power supply when it is turned off and disconnected?
distractors: Static electricity could damage the grounding system
Circulating currents inside the transformer might cause damage
The fuse might blow if you remove the cover
questions.answer: You might receive an electric shock from the charge stored in large capacitors

subTopics.label: T0B
subTopics.description: Antenna safety: tower safety and grounding; erecting an antenna support; safely installing an antenna

questions.label: T0B01
questions.text: When should members of a tower work team wear a hard hat and safety glasses?
distractors: At all times except when climbing the tower
At all times except when belted firmly to the tower
Only when the tower exceeds 30 feet in height
questions.answer: At all times when any work is being done on the tower

questions.label: T0B02
questions.text: What is a good precaution to observe before climbing an antenna tower?
distractors: Make sure that you wear a grounded wrist strap
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: Put on a carefully inspected climbing harness(fall arrester)and safety glasses

questions.label: T0B03
questions.text: Under what circumstances is it safe to climb a tower without a helper or observer?
distractors: When no electrical work is being performed
When no mechanical work is being performed
When the work being done is not more than 20 feet above the ground

questions.label: T0B04
questions.text: Which of the following is an important safety precaution to observe when putting up an antenna tower?
distractors: Wear a ground strap connected to your wrist at all times
Insulate the base of the tower to avoid lightning strikes
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: Look for and stay clear of any overhead electrical wires

questions.label: T0B05
questions.text: What is the purpose of a gin pole?
distractors: To be used in place of a safety harness
questions.answer: To lift tower sections or antennas

questions.label: T0B06
questions.text: What is the minimum safe distance from a power line to allow when installing an antenna?
distractors: Half the width of your property
The height of the power line above ground
questions.answer: Enough so that if the antenna falls unexpectedly, no part of it can come closer than 10 feet to the power wires

questions.label: T0B07
questions.text: Which of the following is an important safety rule to remember when using a crank-up tower?
distractors: This type of tower must never be painted
This type of tower must never be grounded
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: This type of tower must not be climbed unless retracted or mechanical safety locking devices have been installed

questions.label: T0B08
questions.text: What is considered to be a proper grounding method for a tower?
distractors: A single four-foot ground rod, driven into the ground no more than 12 inches from the base
A ferrite-core RF choke connected between the tower and ground
A connection between the tower base and a cold water pipe
questions.answer: Separate eight-foot long ground rods for each tower leg, bonded to the tower and each other

questions.label: T0B09
questions.text: Why should you avoid attaching an antenna to a utility pole?
distractors: The antenna will not work properly because of induced voltages
The utility company will charge you an extra monthly fee
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: The antenna could contact high-voltage power lines

questions.label: T0B10
questions.text: Which of the following is true when installing grounding conductors used for lightning protection?
distractors: Only non-insulated wire must be used
Wires must be carefully routed with precise right-angle bends

questions.label: T0B11
questions.text: Which of the following establishes grounding requirements for an amateur radio tower or antenna?

questions.label: T0B12
questions.text: Which of the following is good practice when installing ground wires on a tower for lightning protection?
distractors: Put a loop in the ground connection to prevent water damage to the ground system
Make sure that all bends in the ground wires are clean, right-angle bends
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: Ensure that connections are short and direct

questions.label: T0B13
questions.text: What is the purpose of a safety wire through a turnbuckle used to tension guy lines?
distractors: Secure the guy if the turnbuckle breaks
Deter unauthorized climbing of the tower
questions.answer: Prevent loosening of the guy line from vibration

subTopics.label: T0C
subTopics.description: RF hazards: radiation exposure; proximity to antennas; recognized safe power levels; exposure to others; radiation types; duty cycle

questions.label: T0C01
questions.text: What type of radiation are VHF and UHF radio signals?

questions.label: T0C02
questions.text: Which of the following frequencies has the lowest value for Maximum Permissible Exposure limit?

questions.label: T0C03
questions.text: What is the maximum power level that an amateur radio station may use at VHF frequencies before an RF exposure evaluation is required?

questions.label: T0C04
questions.text: What factors affect the RF exposure of people near an amateur station antenna?
distractors: Frequency and power level of the RF field
Distance from the antenna to a person
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T0C05
questions.text: Why do exposure limits vary with frequency?
distractors: Lower frequency RF fields have more energy than higher frequency fields
Lower frequency RF fields do not penetrate the human body
Higher frequency RF fields are transient in nature
questions.answer: The human body absorbs more RF energy at some frequencies than at others

questions.label: T0C06
questions.text: Which of the following is an acceptable method to determine that your station complies with FCC RF exposure regulations?
distractors: By calculation based on FCC OET Bulletin 65
By calculation based on computer modeling
By measurement of field strength using calibrated equipment
questions.answer: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T0C07
questions.text: What could happen if a person accidentally touched your antenna while you were transmitting?
distractors: Touching the antenna could cause television interference
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: They might receive a painful RF burn

questions.label: T0C08
questions.text: Which of the following actions might amateur operators take to prevent exposure to RF radiation in excess of FCC-supplied limits?
distractors: All of these choices are correct

questions.label: T0C09
questions.text: How can you make sure your station stays in compliance with RF safety regulations?
distractors: By informing the FCC of any changes made in your station
By making sure your antennas have low SWR
All of these choices are correct
questions.answer: By re-evaluating the station whenever an item of equipment is changed

questions.label: T0C10
questions.text: Why is duty cycle one of the factors used to determine safe RF radiation exposure levels?
distractors: It affects the peak exposure of people to radiation
It takes into account the antenna feed line loss
It takes into account the thermal effects of the final amplifier
questions.answer: It affects the average exposure of people to radiation

questions.label: T0C11
questions.text: What is the definition of duty cycle during the averaging time for RF exposure?
distractors: The difference between the lowest power output and the highest power output of a transmitter
The difference between the PEP and average power output of a transmitter
The percentage of time that a transmitter is not transmitting
questions.answer: The percentage of time that a transmitter is transmitting

questions.label: T0C12
questions.text: How does RF radiation differ from ionizing radiation (radioactivity)?
distractors: RF radiation can only be detected with an RF dosimeter
RF radiation is limited in range to a few feet
questions.answer: RF radiation does not have sufficient energy to cause genetic damage

questions.label: T0C13
questions.text: If the averaging time for exposure is 6 minutes, how much power density is permitted if the signal is present for 3 minutes and absent for 3 minutes rather than being present for the entire 6 minutes?
distractors: There is no adjustment allowed for shorter exposure times
